text: The 1986 Montreal Expos season was the 18th season in franchise history. ==Offseason== * October 24, 1985: Bill Laskey was traded by the Expos to the San Francisco Giants for George Riley and Alonzo Powell.George Riley at Baseball-Reference * November 7, 1985: Mel Rojas was signed by the Expos as an amateur free agent.Mel Rojas at Baseball-Reference * November 8, 1985: Razor Shines was released by the Expos.Razor Shines at Baseball-Reference * December 11, 1985: Roy Johnson was drafted from the Expos by the Chicago White Sox in the 1985 minor league draft.Roy Johnson at Baseball-Reference * December 16, 1985: Steve Baker was traded by the Expos to the Baltimore Orioles for Nelson Norman.Nelson Norman at Baseball-Reference * December 19, 1985: Bill Gullickson and Sal Butera were traded by the Expos to the Cincinnati Reds for Jay Tibbs, Andy McGaffigan, John Stuper, and Dann Bilardello.Bill Gullickson at Baseball-Reference * December 27, 1985: Curt Brown was signed as a free agent by the Expos.Curt Brown at Baseball-Reference * January 13, 1986: Mike Fuentes was traded by the Expos to the Oakland Athletics for Tom Romano.Mike Fuentes at Baseball-Reference * February 25, 1986: Bob Owchinko was signed as a Free Agent with the Montreal Expos.https://www.baseball- reference.com/players/o/owchibo01.shtml * March 26, 1986: Jack O'Connor was released by the Expos.Jack O'Connor at Baseball-Reference * March 31, 1986: Norm Charlton and a player to be named later were traded by the Expos to the Cincinnati Reds for Wayne Krenchicki. The Expos completed the deal by sending Tim Barker (minors) to the Reds on April 2.Wayne Krenchicki at Baseball- Reference * March 31, 1986: Fred Manrique was traded by the Expos to the St. Louis Cardinals for Tom Nieto.Tom Nieto at Baseball-Reference ==Spring training== The Expos held spring training at West Palm Beach Municipal Stadium in West Palm Beach, Florida – a facility they shared with the Atlanta Braves. It was their 10th season at the stadium; they had conducted spring training there from 1969 to 1972 and since 1981. ==Regular season== * July 6, 1986: In an 11-8 loss to the Expos, Bob Horner of the Atlanta Braves hit four home runs in one game. Horner became the second player in the 20th century (Gil Hodges was the first in 1950) to hit four home runs in one game in his home park.Great Baseball Feats, Facts and Figures, 2008 Edition, p. 258, David Nemec and Scott Flatow, A Signet Book, Penguin Group, New York, He became the first player since Ed Delahanty to hit four home runs in a losing game. ===Season standings=== ===Record vs. opponents=== ===Opening Day starters=== *Hubie Brooks *Andre Dawson *Vance Law *Tom Nieto *Tim Raines *Jason Thompson *Jay Tibbs *Tim Wallach *Mitch Websterhttp://baseball- almanac.com/teamstats/roster.php?y=1986&t;=MON ===Notable transactions=== * April 1, 1986: Terry Francona was released by the Expos.Terry Francona at Baseball-Reference * April 5, 1986: Doug Frobel was traded by the Montreal Expos to the New York Mets for Joe Graves (minors) and Rodger Cole (minors).https://www.baseball-reference.com/players/f/frobedo01.shtml * June 2, 1986: 1986 Major League Baseball draft ** Kent Bottenfield was drafted by the Montreal Expos in the 4th round. Player signed June 5, 1986.https://www.baseball-reference.com/players/b/botteke01.shtml ** Mike Blowers was drafted by the Expos in the 10th round. Player signed June 13, 1986.Mike Blowers at Baseball-Reference * June 10, 1986: Johnnie LeMaster was signed as a Free Agent with the Montreal Expos.https://www.baseball- reference.com/players/l/lemasjo01.shtml * June 16, 1986: The Expos traded a player to be named later to the Baltimore Orioles for Dennis Martínez and a player to be named later. The Orioles completed their part of the deal by sending John Stefero to the Expos on December 8. The Expos completed the deal by sending Rene Gonzales to the Orioles on December 16.Dennis Martínez at Baseball-Reference *July 9, 1986: Johnnie LeMaster was released by the Montreal Expos. * July 24, 1986: Dan Schatzeder and Skeeter Barnes were traded by the Expos to the Philadelphia Phillies for Tom Foley and Lary Sorensen.Dan Schatzeder at Baseball-Reference * July 25, 1986: Razor Shines was signed as a free agent by the Expos. ===Roster=== {| class="toccolours" style="font-size: 95%;" |- !
